intro: Convolvulus breviacuminatus, commonly known as the short-stemmed bindweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, sprawling stems and small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant produces small, round berries that contain the seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its rapid growth and ability to spread vegetatively make it an aggressive weed in some environments.
